slot.translation[0].definitions[0].defin: a long narrow hole in a surface, that you can put something into
slot.translation[0].definitions[0].examp: Alan dropped another quarter into the slot on the pay phone.
slot.translation[0].definitions[1].defin: a short period of time allowed for one particular event on a programme or timetable
slot.translation[0].definitions[1].examp: a ten-minute slot on the breakfast show
A new comedy is scheduled for the 9 pm time slot.
slot.translation[1].definitions[0].defin: to go into a slot, or to put something in a slot
slot.translation[1].definitions[0].examp: All the wood parts come pre-cut so that they can be slotted together (=put together using slots).
Mary slotted the key into the lock.
Each length of board slots easily into the next.
slot.translation[2].definitions[0].defin: a short period of time allowed for one particular event in a series of other similar events
slot.translation[2].definitions[0].examp: At one time, the airline held 38% of the available take-off and landing slots at Heathrow Airport.
There’s a repeat of the daytime show in thelate-night slot.
slot.translation[2].definitions[1].defin: a particular job in an organization
slot.translation[2].definitions[1].examp: The board elected a new director to fill one of the slots.
4,000 slots, mostly white-collar, could be eliminated from the company’s Missouri plant alone.
